result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Jasper Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the DNA surcharge during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all other costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DV assessment due to defendant's inability to pay.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victims without the approval of the probation agent.  Third party contact for purposes of child visitation.
No contact with firearms.

Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program.
Take all prescribed medication.
Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Attend probation review hearing.

AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.  If not on prescribed medication, the absolute sobriety.  Random screens.
______
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already  done so.

timeConds.notes:
*** 11-06-15/ Judge Rebecca Dallet***
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.


STAYED for the use at the discretion of the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Jasper Harper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 11-026-15 Court order imposing 30 days condition time

Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve  84  DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 84 days; TIME SERVED.

As to Count 4:
Court ordered defendant to serve  9  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 2; credit for Zero days served.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so

As to Count 4:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  2  YEARS with the following conditions:

- Court ordered 30 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- If not on prescribed medication, then Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victims without the approval of the probation agent
- 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation
- Pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- Court waives all other costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DV assessment) due to the defendant's inability to pay
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-2015.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in court with Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 2 and Count 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1, Count 3 and Count 5:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1, Count 3 and Count 5 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 40.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Kremers.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.

Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Doctor's Report Return. Parties do not contest findings in the report. Court ordered proceedings and bail reinstated. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOW IN COURT.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court suspended proceedings. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned for a Return of Doctor's Report.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Daniel Jasper Harper not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defendant NOT in court, counsel advised the court that defendant demands to appear. Case passed to allow defendant to be produced.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, PRO SE: Motion for Speedy Trial.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LAVITTA M. OR LAMESHA L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Daniel Jasper Harper in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge GRADY.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
